Not a big deal to have inexperienced servers when you're not having to depend on them for your food, but it just made the experience a bit less polished than it could have been.  One funny note - one of the options that was available on the conveyor belt was dessert. That included pudding (chocolate and vanilla snack packs) and mixed fruit (in a pop top can). We were all moms so could see some of the wisdom in those options, but it was still amusing.  All in all, a good experience and I will plan to return!

I have never had a worse experience at a sushi bar before tonight. I brought my friend there tonight because I thought she'd enjoy it. Literally, we were ignored. The server did not once come by to check up on us, even for a water refill. We had to constantly get up from the table or call someone. It was incredibly annoying. Servers are not entitled to a tip. If there is no service, then no tip will be provided. I will never return to this establishment and I'll make sure none of my friends go. I'd get better service at a fast food restaurant like McDonald's than here.

I love this place! With the sushi on the conveyer belts you are able to grab whatever looks good  & pay by the plate. Really decently priced. I've feed a family of 6 for around $50. I love the crab items personally & usually grab a good 10 plates. The red dragon is my favorite.

My daughter loves this place, I on the other hand was not so impressed. I admit the whole revolving Sushi belt is cute. You can sample lots of diconversationhes without waiting, prices correlate with plate colors eg yellow plate $1.50 or purple plate is $2 50. The seating is not great if you have more than 2~3 ppl because then you are side by side making conversation difficult. The sushi was ok, not great and I was put off by the pudding and fruit cups that were also on the conveyor belt...Dole fruit cups in a tin...smh

Where to begin. We found ourselves here because of a groupon.. Good deal so we thought we would give it a try. The service started off on a bad note. As we came in there were several open tables and seats at the counter that just needed to be cleaned. We were told 5-10 min wait, after 20 minutes we were finally brought to the counter with the open seats around us full of dirty dishes, not the most appealing. When our waitress came to take our drink order she had no idea what a Kirin Light was and ended up bringing regular Kirin beer, when I asked for the correct beer she rushed off but never returned. I had to ask a separate server. Long story short I thought the service was terrible.   As for the sushi... Maybe it is a me problem because I have higher expectations but this sushi was pretty bad. The concept of the revolving belt is that the plates are color coordinated: white=$1 yellow=$1.5 blue=$2 purple=$2.5 and black=$3. Anything that looked edible was blue or above. With that being said there were a few things that came by that I thought were decent but it was one of those places where all the rolls tasted the same... Suped up California roll. I think my favorite thing I ate were the spring rolls.   While I love the concept of the revolving sushi we have yet to find a place that does it well. We will not be back. Our bill without the groupon would have been about $60... I will take my business to Masa down the street for cheap but fresh sushi!

Ehhh   It's $1-3 sushi. You don't expect much. But freshness is all gone now ! Maybe because summer in az is so slow for business.  Had salmon and even as Asian as I am couldn't swallow it o-o). Lol and albacore looked like dried jerky !    W that being said it's spinning sushi, can't be fresh though this location lately is bad , but Kids love them! Lol so 3 stars for cheap, happy kids meal!  But stay away from anything raw .    He likes egg sushi and coconut shrimp.      Server is alway pleasant  :)  I'll just let the kid eat his non raw items and I'll eat at home lol

Sushi is ok, not the best, but decent given the prices. We came in on a Saturday during lunch and it was not crowded at all. Great place if you want to satisfy your sushi craving fast. The nigiri was pretty good and overall the sushi was very fresh. Lots of selection too.
Delaney was an awesome waitress! We came in late on a Sunday and she was seriously THEE best! Super honest and attentive! Plus she dresses super cute! She made the experience so much more!

*Do not let these fancy pictures fool you* I first dined at this establishment when it first opened, and they were fantastic and very clean. My wife and I just moved back to the area, and I decided to take her here based on good memories. As soon as I say down I was very, very hesitant due to the fact that the first player I removed from the moving line up was a warmish California roll, so to avoid possibly getting sick we decided to order from the menu's instead for a fresher option. "Wrong" it seemed like they just walked around and picked the items off the belt as the cold were getting warm and the warm items were cold. After eating we went home I felt slightly sick to my stomach didn't think much of it until my wife was sick and dizzy with food poisoning symptoms. This place was great but now cleanliness is out all of their domes covering the food have grit and whatever else on them and the belts have food mush and crumbs all over. Clean, clean, clean please but new plastic domes fix this place.

The variety of sushi has definitely gotten better over time. My favorite is the Strawberry Rolls; they are absolutely amazing!! It's good to come about an hour after they have opened so everything is fresh and the warm things are warm.

The sushi was not very authentic, this is the first time I have actually had lettuce in a roll. Gyoza dipping sauce was good, garlic edamame was really eel sauce maybe teriyaki sauce with minced garlic from a jar. I put in a request for a crunch roll and received a spicy salmon roll with tempura flake. Miso soup was good, hot and sour was not very spicy, tasted very watered down. Grilled chicken w/ rice was ok. Don't be discouraged if this is your first visit to a revolving sushi bar, there are others(TEHARU) that are very good. Selections were limited.

If I work late and just want a quick, no-frills dinner for myself, I like popping by Ahi Revolving Sushi. I'll slide in around 8:30pm and I'm out by 9. Also by the time I go they have Happy Hour pricing on their rolls and I get a free miso soup.  Service from the servers and sushi bar chefs is always very friendly.  Whenever I am in the mood for belt-style sushi, my choice is between Teharu (Tempe) or Ahi Revolving Sushi. Teharu (Tempe) is more convenient for me to get to, but their rice to fish/filling proportion is pretty horrendous and poorly rolled. The rolls at Ahi Revolving Sushi are much better proportioned and rolled better. So I find myself driving a little further to go to Ahi Revolving Sushi.
I love the revolving belt and excellent happy hour prices allowing you to easily try several things. The teriyaki chicken bowl was fresh and delicious. I'm excited for the Korean BBQ place next door!

We have been here quite a few times. The last 2 trips were not good. Slow service and the food quality has dropped. On this last trip we weren't even talked to for  10 minutes after being seated. No drink order, no nothing, sure is fun with 2 kids.   I don't think we'll be back unless the owner can explain why the decline in service and food.

Stopped by for a quick bite. Superrrrr friendly service from Katherine, she was SO sweet from the moment we walked in. Sushi was okay, nothing special but not bad either. It's revolving sushi guys so, it won't be the freshest of the fresh. The atmosphere was quiet, I would suggest changing the music to liven the place up.   All in all, we left full and satisfied!
You get good sushi for a really good price way better than RA more bang for your buck

It was very clean, and the service was great. Actually too great, we had multiple servers that checked in on us about every 5 minutes which actually got to be distracting at the frequency. The seating is absolutely cramped, I felt claustrophobic.  Food was mediocre. Nothing was horrible (just very bland) and the nothing was absolutely amazing (Explosion roll was the best). Everything was room temperature which threw me off, but didn't ruin the food.  I will go back because of the pricing and the variety. I love being able to try lots of rolls and new combos in a few bites, and if I don't like it, it's ok, I didn't waste $10 for a large roll like at most restaurants.   I am worried that on a Friday night that only half of the restaurant's revolving lines were open and there were several parking spots right out front. Hope they make it. It's a great concept, the food just needs more flavor.

This place is no good. I've been 3 times, the first time I ate inside and the sushi was warm but the prices were really good. The second time I got take out and it was good.   The third and final time they over charged me by about $5. Their menu says the spicy tuna roll is $4.5 but I was charged $6 and the teriyaki is supposed to be $6.5, but I was charged $8.  I was going to call and complain but then I tasted the chicken teriyaki, the taste was almost indescribable. The chicken was almost stringy and was clearly uncooked and the was wet and sticky and was like rice pudding than a side of rice. After attempting to eat it I knew complaining would be a waste of time because I'll never go back.  Below is a picture of the chicken and their to go menu and my bill

Had a experience here tonight! Delicious food and great service from Kate! We did the all you can eat sushi and got more than our money's worth. Kate's welcoming energy and above and beyond service was exceptional. We will be back!!!

This conveyor belt sushi restaurant is huge! Spacious seating is a plus over Teharu, which for some reason always has half of the seating closed off when I've been there. The interior is cute, and the conveyor belts themselves go by at a slow enough pace that you can grab what you want.   We came here on a Sunday evening, and had no problem getting a seat for 4 people. There were a decent number of people already seated with stacks of colored plates at their tables. The prices of the plates range from $1 to $3, with most plates in the $2 and $2.50 range. The $3 plates that I saw were either cheesecakes or eel nigiri sushi. We grabbed several rolls, some edamame, and 2 salads (Seaweed and squid).  The rolls come in sets of 3, and the size/width of them generally increases with the plate price. Since it's conveyor belt sushi, it's not the best quality, nor did it taste like the freshest sushi, but you go for the concept and to have fun picking out your plates.   The best tasting plates I had were the soy-marinated tuna (Although one piece did have some gristle on it, but hey what do you expect from a $2 plate), and the banana tempura roll. We tried another tempura roll (non-dessert), which tasted like it had been made way ahead of time since the fried breading tasted gummy and soft.  Our total for 4 people with 2 fountain drinks was a little over $40 with tax. Service was great, another plus over Teharu, and drinks were refilled promptly and the waiters were very friendly.  We hadn't heard of this restaurant before until it got posted on Groupon. It's a decent choice for cheap, fast sushi with friendly service and nice atmosphere. If you're in Gilbert and craving sushi, it's a good inexpensive choice!

Here's the low down on this place. The owner does not speak English, not even broken. The service is pretty terrible, you will definitely wait for anything to be served to you, so make sure you're an extremely patient person. There is only one server there that actually does an excellent job, if he's not there we always turn around and walk right out and head over to Teharu (not that their service is really any better). That gentleman deserves a raise, or promotion to management. He has gorgeous blue eyes and cute somewhat higher voice. The rest of the servers look like they could use a bath to be honest. The cooks are really nice and they are clean, they keep their area clean and if you sit by them they will help you if you need anything. Very friendly and welcoming.  The sushi is average, it's not bad or mind blowing. They do have a really good smoked salmon nigiri. This place is only good if you're really hungry and want to eat some inexpensive sushi. It is clear the owner and Managment do not care about reviews or complaints since nothing has changed. I've gone several times hoping things will change and they have not. This place could be really great but the service their really brings it down. Don't waste your time, and make the drive to Sushi Station in Phoenix. The service there is incredible. They actually refill your drinks, even on the busy night. Ahi should take note. Two star rating thanks to the cooks and that one server, they truly deserve the 5 star but the other folks do not.

First of all, before you come here expecting $20 type sushi dishes, you're getting what you pay for.   I love the sushi for the price. It's not bad at all! The most expensive dish you're going to get is the $3. Let me recommend the volcano roll. Best sushi available: it's cheap for its price, and has hot scallops stacked on top from the toaster oven! I get the forest roll as well because I love the cold seaweed on top of it.   I admit the service is slow, but the staff are young and friendly. They're always so sweet every time I go. I suggest you ORDER to the server what you want, and if you're lucky (they're not on the belt yet or don't get put out), you get fresh sushi straight from the chef that don't sit out.   Complimentary miso soup every time so ask for that as well!   I understand the many "below average" reviews but that's because people come to this place expecting expensive creme de la creme sushi when the most expensive is $3. There's pros and cons about this place. If you come here understanding it's not going to be the most tasty sushi you've ever had, it's good. It settles the craving for sushi.

Like a lot of other reviewers a Groupon led me to this place. If you have been to Teharu it is a very similar concept: Conveyer belt w/ different kinds of sushi passing around. If you've never tried it out before I recommend it (especially if you have a group of people that have different tastes).    I like this place better than Teharu because their sushi options are much larger. They have basics like a Vegas roll, salmon (sake) roll and California roll, but they also have a few unique ones. Last time I was in I had a strawberry tuna roll. It sounds bizarre but it was really creative and very tasty!  The only reason I'm giving 4/5 stars is because their miso soup sucks. That and if you order a hot green tea you get a cup with a Lipton green tea bag in it, not a teapot with fresh brewed like you'd imagine.

This place is solid. But you have to understand... it's kaiten-zushi. You won't be enjoying fat pieces of molten toro here, nor will the unagi be freshly broiled, succulent deliciousness. But if you just want a quick sushi fix, you could do a LOT worse. And I have to say- some of the things that I tried were REALLY tasty (the 'salmon nigi' was especially nice).  The service was really friendly- I don't think that my glass of water was ever less than two-thirds full. They seem to really be making an honest attempt at running a good business, I think that people need to just keep their expectations in check.

Bought the $10 for $20 Yelp Deal. Totally worth it!!! We were promptly seated, and all my favorites kept coming out. Rainbow roll, caterpillar roll, seaweed salad, unagi. Yummy! I was pleased with everything, except (ironically) the Happy Roll. It made me unhappy, bc it was chewy. We'll definitely be back. Next time I'm going to check in on Yelp, bc you can get a free milk shake.

First time coming to this restaurant, and we were assisted right away, by someone that was very nice and polite...we've never been in a revolving sushi bar before and didn't really know how it worked, and we had the all you can eat...she instructed us very well! The food was great! What made it even better is our server was on point. I was a server before and I appreciated how attentive she was...our drinks were always full and she made sure we were having a good night. Excellent service!
Second visit here.  Prices are good. Twice experienced less than average quality of fish.    Twice also experienced poor service.   Will not go back.

For the last two weeks, I have been to Ahi 3 times. I love that there is a revolving belt that allows me to try new rolls that I otherwise would not order. I LOVE their Jalapeño Popper things. They are so good. There is always someone constantly making new rolls and putting them out. This place also has decent prices. Pretty comparable to other revolving belt sushi places. I like that the restaurant is always clean and has good decor.

I don't normally choose sushi restaurants that have a conveyor belt bc I don't want to get sick. Pulling up to the building the parking lot was empty at 630 on a Tuesday.. Ok fine, only 1 table in the entire restaurant and we were seated right next to them. Hmm. Ok. My bf decided to pull off a plate bc we were all hungry. It was like a shaggy dog - imitation crab salad roll with tempura crunchies it looked ok, came in 4 pieces. A friend ate 1 piece and said we needed to leave and my bf tried some of the imitation crab and was done. They described it as warm rice with room temp inside and disgusting. We cancelled out drinks and tossed a 5$ on the table and proceeded to leave. The waitress hurriedly rung us up for $2.12. Worst $5 we ever spent on food.  With that being said  - the sushi that passed us didn't look fresh and if it only takes not even a bite to turn you off that's not a risk I'm willing to take. We found another sushi restaurant - yanagi and it was welcoming, delicious and satisfying

The concept is great. The food is good to fair, depending on the dish. The service was quite poor. There were several instances we were provided the wrong order, which could have proved to be dangerous had we not caught it, due to serious food allergies. When pointed out that we were given the wrong order, we were told it was our fault and charged anyhow, even though the order slip was found and indicated the mistake was theirs. Seeing a pattern of getting orders wrong, we attempted to reconfirm our next order numerous times...just to ultimately get another wrong order. We made the best of it. Overall, cool concept, tasty food, but with poor customer service and some operational flaws. The price was very reasonable though.
Tried this place with a groupon. It was alright. The portions were small. I liked the variety and place.

I'm a big sushi person and I haven't really done much revolving sushi. However, this place gave me a "meh" feeling towards it. I hope there are better revolving sushi places out there because I don't want this to be a permanent feeling.   I came here with some great friends and of course I was feeling sushi and was super ready to grub down plates on plates. The outcome however didn't lead that way. The sushi here was very small and the flavoring of each roll just didn't give me that satisfied taste. I had this peanut roll and that just gave me the worst aftertaste. I would no recommend it, maybe it's just me. The tempura roll, crab roll, and Caterpillar roll just wasn't hitting my taste bud as well. They just didn't have the kick of flavor and it felt like the sushi has been there for a while just rotating around collecting air. The staff was pretty slow at getting back to us at well. But I don't want to blame the staff, maybe he was new?   I wouldn't really recommend this place to a friend, especially if they haven't experienced this yet. it would scar myself and make me not change  my thoughts on sushi.

Won't be back.  Sat down at the table for 10 min.  They couldn't be bothered to serve us.  Sushi chef looking right at us numerous times.  Servers too busy goofing around.  Too many other places in the area to take my money!!

Great for fast food sushi! Decent prices, good variety, clean and friendly service. You must try if you are a sushi lover, but not the kind that has made sushi a delicacy with its outrageous prices here in AZ, but the kind of sushi lover that just wants to have their sushi fix without having to save up all month for it!

This was my first time here and I only had some crunchy rolls but they were bomb as heck and they were very inexpensive and as someone else said the eel sauce as a side was like god giving me a hand like wow so bomb and the cashier guy was friendly and I ordered take out and it was really fast. 10/10 do recommend

I've come here several times, each time hoping the service and the quality of the food would improve and that I may have just caught them on a bad day. But each time I go, the service remains S-L-O-W (which is quite the feat, considering it's a self-serving revolving sushi restaurant) and the food gets worse and worse. Needless to say, I do NOT recommend eating here if you want good sushi.

It's not an upscale sushi place, so you definitely get what you pay for. I came in here a few times until I heard the health department got on them for some things; haven't returned since. The food is okay. Sushi is on a conveyor belt which can be a concern if it's on there too long. My main issue was with the service...spent more time waiting around for them than actually eating. I'd like to go back eventually; hopefully the service has improved, because the food is actually pretty solid.

Bought a Groupon $12 for $25 so I thought I'd check it out. I will never go back!  First thing that was very unpleasant was it was freezing in there. I understand they need to keep sushi cold but if it's fresh they shouldn't need to keep it to where our teeth were chattering. Next thing service was extremely slow. I mean come on it's not like you have to deliver much!   The sushi is shitty. There was only one roll we truly liked. I've had revolving sushi else where and I know it's not 4 star sushi but even for lower end sushi it was not worth money. Most of the rolls reminded me of low grade grocery store sushi.   My fiancé isn't too hip into sushi so he ordered the shrimp tempura. It took at least 20 minutes to come out. When it finally came it was freezing cold, inedible and the fried rice was disgusting.   I ordered a piece of sushi that wasn't on the belt and again took forever! I had to give the waiter a displeasing look as he stood around before he realized he forgot.   Do yourself a favor take you money else where even with a Groupon not worth it!!!

I would consider us regulars at this place. Every time we go it is understaffed. Management is seriously lacking. Riley, who seems like the only server here, is usually running around with no help and getting buried with orders. In turn, he'll forget to come back with something. Management, hire another server!!!! Poor guy is running all over the place and not able to provide A+ service.   Now moving on to the busser... I can dig the grunge look, but you're at work. Brush your hair and tie that mop up! The past few times we came in, we see dirty tables EVERYWHERE. Piles of dishes and cups as they tell you, "please sit anywhere you'd like". Uh huh... Theres no clean tables. Meanwhile busser is in the back hanging out with someone. Really guy? Your job is easy enough!    The sushi is not bad. As many others have said, you get what you pay for. What I did not like was that the lids to the plates always seem to be coming off as they go around the conveyor belt. They are morphed, cracked, and dirty. Please replace them. Miso soup was cold.   I'm sad this place has gone so far downhill. We will miss you Ahi sushi! Please get better so we can come back
this was my first experience with the conveyor belt type sushi. The sushi was not good at all. poor quality and tasteless. prices were very cheap which is probably why it was not tasty...
Conveyor belt awesomeness! Big selection, good prices! Just not as fresh as we would like. But Much fresher than some we've been too and they'll make anything you want!

My girl and I  walk in on a Thursday around 6:00 pm.  BIG sign out front saying "Please wait to be seated."  I look around and the place is dimly lit...not in a romantic way, mind you, but more in that, "we just forgot to change the light bulbs" depressing kind of way. After a few minutes of waiting in front of the large "Please wait to be seated" sign, a woman carrying a plastic soda cup while drinking out of it comes towards us and mumbles something about how if, we don't "see a hostess, just go ahead and seat yourself."  Fine, then what the hell is the purpose for the sign?  We walked about three steps towards a booth holding the dingy menus shoved at us, glanced at the sparse and lonely sushi rolls bouncing on the rusty conveyer belt and decided to run away as fast as possible. This place is like something out of a David Lynch movie.  Bizarre.  Maybe I was having a flashback?  No clue.  Not a fan.  Will not think of returning.

I feel really bad posting a one star review but this place was pretty awful. We went at 6pm and it wasn't super busy but we had very poor service. There were only two servers working so i don't know if that's the norm or not. The tables and menus were sticky and the overall cleanliness of the dining area was questionable. The rolls on the conveyer belt were few and far between...but oddly enough there were lots of pudding cups (like pre-packages pudding cups). We ordered rolls and it took almost an hour for those to come out. The dynamite roll I ordered had undercooked (gummy, cold)scallops. I honestly left hoping none of us get sick. Pretty bummed at the experience.  Update- and unfortunately some of us did get food poisoning. Awesome.
Warm sushi... Cold soggy calimari ... This place will definitely get you sick or kill you... Superbly disgusted.

OK, but fun.  Asked me to like them on Facebook while in the restaurant for 15% off the bill.  While I'm not a huge fan of restaurants that bribe customers for social media exposure, at least they weren't trying to bribe for 5 star ratings.  The sushi was ok. Good, but not great. The service was pretty good and they were nice to my daughter.

Stopped by for some lunch, saw this place just driving by. Prices are decent, you get about 3 pieces of a roll for the varying prices. I did get a wiff of spoiled food a few times. I dunno what it was from, but it prevented me from furthering our meal. The service is pretty horrendous, our server didn't even know what siracha was. Asked if I meant eel sauce in a condescending tone. Excuse me what?! I tried several different rolls and was not impressed by any of it. My son had the orange chicken and it was so tangy, he nor I could finish it. I will not be coming back

I won't be back.  Was craving some sashimi for lunch and this place is right around the corner.  Ordered the lunch sashimi special online, and it said it would take 15 minutes.  Got there 20 minutes after ordering and the host said it would still be another 10 minutes.  Hmmm...okay - there were only 4 other people in the restaurant, so I don't know why it would take that long..but I'd wait.  10 minutes later I get my sushi, get back to work, and no chopsticks!  Boo!  So, I start eating with a fork, take 1 bite and immediately spit it out as it was luke warm and tasted foul.  Wasn't worth possibly getting sick.

I go here a bunch. Always tasty and good service. Will be back. I've never had any issues like the other reviewers on here. It's revolving - so be aware that if you go late at night of course like most establishments the food isn't fresh right before closing. Order from the menu if its an issue.

Checked out Ahi even after reading reviews to see if the reviews were spot on.  The service staff is slow at getting the water out. The wasabi is from a tube squeezed out and the portion was uneven to what I had gotten and my wife's.  There was a promo running all plates were 2 dollars. The selection was decent but the quality was subpar,  the basic California rolls were gross. The rice seem very hard. They had some unusual rolls like banana tempura,  rolls with lettuce.   Best roll there was their explosion and Ahi roll.   The quality for the price is in consistent. Some rolls seem to be good value as other rolls were not. They had items like jello for 2 bucks which is a rip off. We also got dessert,  3 flavors of mochi. Ice cream for 2 bucks each too. Once again a rip off. It's 2 bucks for 1 ice cream with a little whip cream and chocolate syrup.   And the place was insanely lit up I felt like I was dining inside a Walmart with there 100 fluorescent lights.  We won't be returning to this establishment again. There are 2 other ones much better in this area.

Not the best sushi I've ever had, but good.  The Revolving sushi conveyor is pretty cool and keeps you interested.  They do have a lot of progressive types of foods that come around as well which make you want to try them and they're good.  Got the Groupon so that made it super cheap....3 of us ate for the $12 and they gave me a free green tea shake just for checking in online.  Service is decent, but could be a little better since we had to keep on our waiter about refilling our sodas, but he was usually not far away or too busy so that wasn't a huge deal.  We went for lunch so it was pretty quiet then and we could just take our time and relax.  I'd go there again.

Ahi's a regular go-to for my family when I come to town. The sushi's relatively cheap, but the quality's good for the price. Plus, I don't think many people go to a revolving sushi place expecting a high-end meal.  I don't live in Gilbert these days, but my mom and sister always try to take me for a girls day out lunch when I come to town, and every time I've been by, they've been understaffed to the point of having one server who has to act as the host as well during a peak lunch hour. That being said, our server tried to stay on top of things and was a champ.

The quality of the sushi was poor, salmon was discolored.  The overall experience was bad.  we could not understand the waiter and the selection of sushi on the conveyor  belt was poor.  We've eaten here previously and it appears the quality of the fish has gone down hill.  For a Friday night, the restaurant was a ghost town.

I'm torn because the only reason the stars aren't higher is because the service is so slow! But this is my family's go-to place for dinner. The sushi is good and inexpensive and the hot food is great. I have two kids (6 & 5) who love the revolving sushi and the variety works for them, plus there are small dessert options! If the service was more organized and quicker, I'd definitely up it a star.

After reading the reviews I was kind of hesitant to try this place. Been to Teharu plenty of times. But last night my friend and I decided to give them a try. To my surprise, it was really good. I really like how they had a variety if different rolls versus just the usual California roll and what not. For $35 my friend and left completely stuffed. It was really reasonably priced and you could try a little bit of everything versus paying $12 for a roll at another sushi place. The restaurant was really clean and modern looking and can really fit a lot of people.  It's also a lot closer to me than teharu. :) I will definitely be back!

People are always skeptical about these revolving sushi places but first time here it was good but could have use more variety though on the revolving plates of sushi  You can also order off the revolving plates menu but they didn't have udon available  Overall good sushi/ rolls

I am a super fan!  Recommendation: 1. Go towards the end of the rush. There is a lot of sushi plates on their way to you from the conveyer belts and you don't have to sit RIGHT next to interesting characters. 2. Get the groupon for 2 people if you are skeptical and (its still available), its $25 off your first visit 3. If you can, sit close to the Sushi Chefs bar. You get first pick and the rolls are not 'slim pickings'  Pros: 1.You get sushi QUICK! 2.You can try several options and not have to spend 8 bucks on a roll you realize you don't like and waste it like other places. (Plates are 1-3 bucks and have 2-3 pieces on them.) 3. The food was decent. If you're one of those die hard sushi fans; its not 5 star restaurant. Its a quick, fun sushi place, not fine dining with flare and ambiance. But if you want a good time, with good quick (keyword quick) sushi, I HIGHLY recommend this place.  Cons: 1. Its kind of all over the place; the waitress staff can sometimes take a while... and I mean 40 minutes to get the check... My recommendation, ask for things like the bill early on, and utilize the staff if you see them walking around even if its not your waiter/waitress. 2. I could see how the temperature could get a little warm during rush hour. Go first before everyone else, or when people start trickling out.  I am a big fan!

I'm alwayssssss up for trying new sushi! Especially if it's inexpensive and revolving! =)  We had bought a Groupon for this place and it's actually right down the street from my house so we wanted to try it out. I guess I kind of went in with high expectations since my other favorite revolving sushi place is Teharu and I absolutely love them...  I felt like the food portions were sooooo tiny... I felt like they did this on purpose so you keep getting more and more sushi. Not only that but the sushi just didn't taste fresh. I think it was just straight bland. There were a few rolls that had such a strange combination. For example, there was a roll that had peanuts with avocado. No bueno! Then you had your tempura mixed with bananas. lol. I see that they're trying to make their rolls creative but I can't see peanuts, rice and avocado being a good mix.   The only good thing I would say is that the staff was extremely friendly. At the end though we didn't reach our limit on our Groupon and it took them what felt like forever to figure it out. I most likely won't be coming back here to get my sushi fix on. =/

Time to update the reviews on this place. Me and wife wanted some sushi again, we showed up..glad to see the place was packed and looks like its doing really well for itself.  Something has somewhat changed here. The decor still rocks, but the atmosphere seems some what lacking.   Customer Service: seemed to have slipped here, as with so many patrons that it looks disorganized with 3 people cleaning and resetting a table when there are customers who are waiting for orders or drink refills such as I was.   We also ordered off the menu and it took nearly 15 minutes to bring out half and we never received an avocado roll that was ordered which we waited for 30 minutes for. Our waiter also disappeared for a little bit and none of the other waiters were able to fill his role or help out with the table.   Also one last thing that the workers all seemed unhappy and gave a weird unwelcoming vibe.  Food Quality Does not match pricing any more: They also seemed to have raised the prices now to the point where they are trying to match higher end restaurants. Such as the unagi which I can get for $4-$6 for about 4 pieces here its $4 for a plate for 3 in small sizes. There are hardly any $1 white places and my wife loves avocado rolls which there are none to be seen.   I hope they get their act together soon and reestablish the values it had when it first opened, as me and wife had previously enjoyed this place.

My boys love the revolving sushi . They get so excited. The service never disappoints here. We love watching the chef make sushi. This is our reliable sushi spot. We've been to a few in chandler Gilbert area and we always migrate back to this one.

I used to go to Teharu a lot. By comparison this place is miles ahead. The selection and quality of sushi is better and the service is better. We came on a weekday at 4:30 and the place was nearly empty. The staff went out of their way to meet our needs and help us feel welcomed. The price is comparable to Teharu, my wife and I ate our fill for about $25.  Never going back to Teharu, this place is awesome.  There is a 10% discount for coming on weekdays, just FYI!

New Revolving sushi in town and a Groupon for it. . . . SOLD! After buying this Groupon deal online we came here last night for dinner. The decor and style of the restaurant was very hip and colorful. The layout of the establishment was horrible. If you were sitting in the inner bar and wanted to use the restroom. You had to walk all the way around and over, Just to get to it.   The service was awesome; friendly and helpful. Thank you, Carlos.    The food: Let's just say I enjoyed the coconut shrimp and fried rice more than the sushi. The sushi was very SMALL portioned and bland - I've been to many revolving sushi establishments around town and never seen/had such a small amount of sushi on a plate for the same price.  PS if it hadn't been for the great service, this place would have gotten a one star.

Customer service was amazing. Waiter was super friendly. With this place you can special order which I liked. The sushi was "okay". I would come back if I was in the area. I def did not have to wait 45 minutes like I did with another sushi place so it was worth it.

I really like this place. The whole conveyor belt is filled with food the whole time. The hostess/server is really sweet. I don't know her name but she is the one with the cute hipster glasses. She was frequently checking on us to make sure we were ok, and was even concerned whether I liked a new drink I tried. If they don't have an option on the belt just ask and it is real quick to come out

Just tried the salmon nigiri and yellowtail  - fresh  and prepared right at the table. Had the house hot sake,  priced reasonable for a house blend. If you eat at the sushi bar all the plates are color-coded by price level, so for about 20 bucks including drink and tips you get a nice selection. Even includes a free bowl of delicious miso soup!  I will be back again  - Sam my sushi chef and Maddie my waitress were delightful!
I truly enjoy this atmosphere and the peacefulness. Other places like Kona are too loud and over priced. Recommend eating here for a simple date night !
Scary sushi!! I've been to many conveyor belt sushi bars. Never been so worried about food poisoning!

I bought a groupon because it looked interesting but had reviews all over the place. It's a fun concept and definitely a unique experience. The sushi is not bad but it's not excellent either. I have discovered though that I really prefer my food to just come to me, I didn't really enjoy having to try to snatch off the belt. The portion sizes are small it's 3 pieces to a plate but the price isn't too bad. So if you're looking for a different experience I would recommend it.

Terrible service. We walked in and the waitress that greeted us said that they were completely full, even though half the restaurant was empty. We asked if we could sit at one of the empty tables and she was like, "Ummmm I guess..."  Food was not good, but what do you expect with the prices? You get what you pay for. We had to wait for a LONG time to get our check, our drinks, etc. We will NOT ever be returning and I recommend you take your business elsewhere with all the cute places Gilbert has to offer.
We enjoyed, the experience and now that we know what  a revolving sushi bar will try it again.

We love this place.  We came for my daughter's bday.  She requested to go and of course we were excited.  I was not as impressed as I have been in the past.  It was not as clean as I have seen in the past.  Sushi that was on the conveyor was still revolving when we left.  My Dads and my first plate was warm.  Many of the mini plate covers need replaced.  I have some suggestions...come up with a marking system to gauge how long a plate has been on the belt.  Is there such thing as a cooling conveyor belt?  Wait staff was personable and attentive.  We would love to come back!

I wish I could give them more stars. I really love revolving sushi, well sushi in general, but Teharu and Sushi Station (my favorite) are better.  What I will give them is 1 point because it's revolving sushi and 1 point because it's clean and modern inside. (Still Teharu, repaint that poop colored wall - Seriously).  Not bad, not great. 2.5 Stars realistically.

Went in last night not busy at all. Not a lot of options. Service was slow. Requested two rolls that were given to someone else by mistake because they forgot who ordered them :( would have eaten more if there were more selections. We've been here many times and usually good service and lots of variety. This time was a total disappointment.

I'm sorry Ahi, your food, it lacks, quality, freshness and pizzaz.  First concentrate on the quality and freshness, the rest will come naturally.  You have hired some of the most darling waitresses and your Groupon was pretty awesome. Even the dining area was clean as a whistle.  But I just can't go back, even if my daughter begs me, again.   The East Valley really needs Kaiten stylei because it's fun and who doesn't like food slowly moving by, tempting us to try something new? Ahi, I hope this place will be you someday! I really do!

Just wanted to say that these guys are amazing. Stopped in just before closing time, and they made it clear we were welcome. They made us fresh food, to order, and didn't act like we were imposing on them whatsoever. Their food is always fresh and well prepared, but to stay after closing time a day take care of us the way they did, was sure the extra mile. We will be back!

If you want the experience of "revolving" sushi then this the place. If you don't mind over priced, subpar sushi on that conveyor belt that is. The whole experience in my book was somewhat distracting . The service was absolutely terrible. The waiter was not friendly and was not knowledgeable of the sushi.   Overall good for a one time experience but we won't go back.  I'll forgo the conveyor belt for better sushi and a better atmosphere any time!

I have been to a few other revolving sushi bars and I will have to say this place has a lot to learn about doing business. It took about 15 mins just to get our drink order (water) and the place wasn't to busy. The selection of food on the belt was very slim and looked as if it been sitting fir a while. I was a little unhappy after I found out it was cheaper to purchase the gyoza from the menu then (6pcs for 2.00, instead of 3 pcs for the grand opening every plate 2.00 off the belt).   I tried the mango shrimp roll and the mango wasn't even ripe.  We had a lot of uneaten food as the taste and quality was poor. I know for sure I will not be returning to this place.

My boyfriend and I just wandered in and we were pleasantly surprised! I'm a waitress and I felt the service was a little slow, foods temperature was a little off but had great flavor! Loved that we could try multiple different things! Cheap and yummy date night. We will be back :)
Good sushi for the price! I recommend to those who are looking for a quick sushi craving solution.
